verses.kjv: And it came to pass in those days, that there went out a decree from Caesar Augustus, that all the world should be taxed.
verses.web: Now in those days, a decree went out from Caesar Augustus that all the world should be enrolled.
verses.ct: Around that time, Caesar Augustus issued a decree requiring a census of the entire Roman world.

verses.kjv: (And this taxing was first made when Cyrenius was governor of Syria.)
verses.web: This was the first enrollment made when Quirinius was governor of Syria.
verses.ct: This was the first census taken while Quirinius was governor of Syria.

verses.kjv: And all went to be taxed, every one into his own city.
verses.web: All went to enroll themselves, everyone to his own city.
verses.ct: Everyone had to travel to their ancestral hometown to be registered.

verses.kjv: And Joseph also went up from Galilee, out of the city of Nazareth, into Judaea, unto the city of David, which is called Bethlehem; (because he was of the house and lineage of David:)
verses.web: Joseph also went up from Galilee, out of the city of Nazareth, into Judea, to David’s city, which is called Bethlehem, because he was of the house and family of David;
verses.ct: So Joseph traveled from the town of Nazareth in Galilee to Judea, to the city of David called Bethlehem, because he was a descendant of David's family line.

verses.kjv: To be taxed with Mary his espoused wife, being great with child.
verses.web: to enroll himself with Mary, who was pledged to be married to him as wife, being pregnant.
verses.ct: He went to register there along with Mary, who was pledged to marry him and was expecting a child.

verses.kjv: And so it was, that, while they were there, the days were accomplished that she should be delivered.
verses.web: While they were there, the day had come for her to give birth.
verses.ct: While they were in Bethlehem, the time came for her baby to be born.

verses.kjv: And she brought forth her firstborn son, and wrapped him in swaddling clothes, and laid him in a manger; because there was no room for them in the inn.
verses.web: She gave birth to her firstborn son. She wrapped him in bands of cloth, and laid him in a feeding trough, because there was no room for them in the inn.
verses.ct: She gave birth to her firstborn son, wrapped him snugly in strips of cloth, and laid him in a manger, because there was no room for them at the inn.

verses.kjv: And there were in the same country shepherds abiding in the field, keeping watch over their flock by night.
verses.web: There were shepherds in the same country staying in the field, and keeping watch by night over their flock.
verses.ct: Nearby, shepherds were out in the fields, keeping watch over their flocks through the night.

verses.kjv: And, lo, the angel of the Lord came upon them, and the glory of the Lord shone round about them: and they were sore afraid.
verses.web: Behold, an angel of the Lord stood by them, and the glory of the Lord shone around them, and they were terrified.
verses.ct: Suddenly an angel of the Lord appeared to them, and the glory of the Lord blazed all around them. They were terrified.

verses.kjv: And the angel said unto them, Fear not: for, behold, I bring you good tidings of great joy, which shall be to all people.
verses.web: The angel said to them, “Don’t be afraid, for behold, I bring you good news of great joy which will be to all the people.
verses.ct: But the angel said to them, "Don't be afraid! I'm here to bring you wonderful news that will fill everyone with great joy."

verses.kjv: For unto you is born this day in the city of David a Saviour, which is Christ the Lord.
verses.web: For there is born to you today, in David’s city, a Savior, who is Christ the Lord.
verses.ct: "Today in the city of David, a Savior has been born for you — he is Christ the Lord."

verses.kjv: And this shall be a sign unto you; Ye shall find the babe wrapped in swaddling clothes, lying in a manger.
verses.web: This is the sign to you: you will find a baby wrapped in strips of cloth, lying in a feeding trough.”
verses.ct: "Here's how you'll recognize him: you'll find a baby wrapped in strips of cloth, lying in a manger."

verses.kjv: And suddenly there was with the angel a multitude of the heavenly host praising God, and saying,
verses.web: Suddenly, there was with the angel a multitude of the heavenly army praising God, and saying,
verses.ct: Then all at once, a massive army of angels appeared alongside the first, praising God and saying,

verses.kjv: Glory to God in the highest, and on earth peace, good will toward men.
verses.web: “Glory to God in the highest, on earth peace, good will toward men.”
verses.ct: "Glory to God in the highest heavens, and on earth peace and good will toward men."

verses.kjv: And it came to pass, as the angels were gone away from them into heaven, the shepherds said one to another, Let us now go even unto Bethlehem, and see this thing which is come to pass, which the Lord hath made known unto us.
verses.web: When the angels went away from them into the sky, the shepherds said to one another, “Let’s go to Bethlehem, now, and see this thing that has happened, which the Lord has made known to us.”
verses.ct: After the angels left them and returned to heaven, the shepherds said to each other, "Let's go to Bethlehem right now and see this thing the Lord has told us about!"

verses.kjv: And they came with haste, and found Mary, and Joseph, and the babe lying in a manger.
verses.web: They came with haste, and found both Mary and Joseph, and the baby was lying in the feeding trough.
verses.ct: They hurried off and found Mary and Joseph, and the baby lying in the manger.

verses.kjv: And when they had seen it, they made known abroad the saying which was told them concerning this child.
verses.web: When they saw it, they publicized widely the saying which was spoken to them about this child.
verses.ct: After seeing the child, they spread the word everywhere about what the angel had told them about him.

verses.kjv: And all they that heard it wondered at those things which were told them by the shepherds.
verses.web: All who heard it wondered at the things which were spoken to them by the shepherds.
verses.ct: Everyone who heard the shepherds' story was amazed.

verses.kjv: But Mary kept all these things, and pondered them in her heart.
verses.web: But Mary kept all these sayings, pondering them in her heart.
verses.ct: But Mary treasured all these things, turning them over and over in her heart.

verses.kjv: And the shepherds returned, glorifying and praising God for all the things that they had heard and seen, as it was told unto them.
verses.web: The shepherds returned, glorifying and praising God for all the things that they had heard and seen, just as it was told them.
verses.ct: The shepherds headed back to their flocks, praising and glorifying God for everything they had heard and seen — it was exactly as the angel had told them.

verses.kjv: And when eight days were accomplished for the circumcising of the child, his name was called JESUS, which was so named of the angel before he was conceived in the womb.
verses.web: When eight days were fulfilled for the circumcision of the child, his name was called Jesus, which was given by the angel before he was conceived in the womb.
verses.ct: On the 8th day, when it was time for the child to be circumcised, they named him Jesus — the name the angel had given him before he was even conceived.

verses.kjv: And when the days of her purification according to the law of Moses were accomplished, they brought him to Jerusalem, to present him to the Lord;
verses.web: When the days of their purification according to the law of Moses were fulfilled, they brought him up to Jerusalem, to present him to the Lord
verses.ct: When the time came for the purification ceremony required by the law of Moses, Joseph and Mary brought Jesus to Jerusalem to present him to the Lord.

verses.kjv: (As it is written in the law of the LORD, Every male that openeth the womb shall be called holy to the Lord;)
verses.web: (as it is written in the law of the Lord, “Every male who opens the womb shall be called holy to the Lord”),
verses.ct: This was in keeping with what is written in the law of the LORD: "Every firstborn male shall be set apart as holy to the Lord."

verses.kjv: And to offer a sacrifice according to that which is said in the law of the Lord, A pair of turtledoves, or two young pigeons.
verses.web: and to offer a sacrifice according to that which is said in the law of the Lord, “A pair of turtledoves, or two young pigeons.”
verses.ct: They also offered the sacrifice required by the law of the Lord: "A pair of turtledoves or two young pigeons."

verses.kjv: And, behold, there was a man in Jerusalem, whose name was Simeon; and the same man was just and devout, waiting for the consolation of Israel: and the Holy Ghost was upon him.
verses.web: Behold, there was a man in Jerusalem whose name was Simeon. This man was righteous and devout, looking for the consolation of Israel, and the Holy Spirit was on him.
verses.ct: Now there was a man in Jerusalem named Simeon. He was righteous and deeply devoted to God, eagerly waiting for God to comfort and rescue Israel. The Holy Spirit rested on him,

verses.kjv: And it was revealed unto him by the Holy Ghost, that he should not see death, before he had seen the Lord’s Christ.
verses.web: It had been revealed to him by the Holy Spirit that he should not see death before he had seen the Lord’s Christ.
verses.ct: and the Holy Spirit had revealed to him that he would not die before he had seen the Lord's Christ.

verses.kjv: And he came by the Spirit into the temple: and when the parents brought in the child Jesus, to do for him after the custom of the law,
verses.web: He came in the Spirit into the temple. When the parents brought in the child, Jesus, that they might do concerning him according to the custom of the law,
verses.ct: Led by the Spirit, Simeon went into the temple that day. When Mary and Joseph brought the child Jesus in to carry out the customary requirements of the law,

verses.kjv: Then took he him up in his arms, and blessed God, and said,
verses.web: then he received him into his arms, and blessed God, and said,
verses.ct: Simeon took the baby in his arms, praised God, and said,

verses.kjv: Lord, now lettest thou thy servant depart in peace, according to thy word:
verses.web: “Now you are releasing your servant, Master, according to your word, in peace;
verses.ct: "Lord, now you can let your servant die in peace, just as you promised."

verses.kjv: For mine eyes have seen thy salvation,
verses.web: for my eyes have seen your salvation,
verses.ct: "My own eyes have seen your salvation —"

verses.kjv: Which thou hast prepared before the face of all people;
verses.web: which you have prepared before the face of all peoples;
verses.ct: "which you have prepared for all people to see —"

verses.kjv: A light to lighten the Gentiles, and the glory of thy people Israel.
verses.web: a light for revelation to the nations, and the glory of your people Israel.”
verses.ct: "a light to reveal truth to the Gentiles, and the glory of your people Israel."

verses.kjv: And Joseph and his mother marvelled at those things which were spoken of him.
verses.web: Joseph and his mother were marveling at the things which were spoken concerning him,
verses.ct: Joseph and his mother were amazed at the things Simeon said about the child.

verses.kjv: And Simeon blessed them, and said unto Mary his mother, Behold, this child is set for the fall and rising again of many in Israel; and for a sign which shall be spoken against;
verses.web: and Simeon blessed them, and said to Mary, his mother, “Behold, this child is set for the falling and the rising of many in Israel, and for a sign which is spoken against.
verses.ct: Then Simeon blessed them and said to Mary his mother, "Listen carefully: this child will cause the falling and rising of many in Israel. He will be a sign that people will speak against."

verses.kjv: (Yea, a sword shall pierce through thy own soul also,) that the thoughts of many hearts may be revealed.
verses.web: Yes, a sword will pierce through your own soul, that the thoughts of many hearts may be revealed.”
verses.ct: "And a sword will pierce your own soul as well — so that the hidden thoughts of many hearts will be exposed."

verses.kjv: And there was one Anna, a prophetess, the daughter of Phanuel, of the tribe of Aser: she was of a great age, and had lived with an husband seven years from her virginity;
verses.web: There was one Anna, a prophetess, the daughter of Phanuel, of the tribe of Asher (she was of a great age, having lived with a husband seven years from her virginity,
verses.ct: There was also a prophetess named Anna, the daughter of Phanuel, from the tribe of Asher. She was very old — she had been married for 7 years before her husband died,

verses.kjv: And she was a widow of about fourscore and four years, which departed not from the temple, but served God with fastings and prayers night and day.
verses.web: and she had been a widow for about eighty-four years), who didn’t depart from the temple, worshiping with fastings and petitions night and day.
verses.ct: and she had been a widow for about 84 years. She never left the temple, worshiping God day and night with fasting and prayer.

verses.kjv: And she coming in that instant gave thanks likewise unto the Lord, and spake of him to all them that looked for redemption in Jerusalem.
verses.web: Coming up at that very hour, she gave thanks to the Lord, and spoke of him to all those who were looking for redemption in Jerusalem.
verses.ct: She came up to them at that very moment, gave thanks to the Lord, and began telling everyone who was waiting for God's redemption in Jerusalem about this child.

verses.kjv: And when they had performed all things according to the law of the Lord, they returned into Galilee, to their own city Nazareth.
verses.web: When they had accomplished all things that were according to the law of the Lord, they returned into Galilee, to their own city, Nazareth.
verses.ct: Once Joseph and Mary had completed everything required by the law of the Lord, they returned to Galilee, to their hometown of Nazareth.

verses.kjv: And the child grew, and waxed strong in spirit, filled with wisdom: and the grace of God was upon him.
verses.web: The child was growing, and was becoming strong in spirit, being filled with wisdom, and the grace of God was upon him.
verses.ct: The child grew and became strong in spirit, filled with wisdom, and the grace of God was on him.

verses.kjv: Now his parents went to Jerusalem every year at the feast of the passover.
verses.web: His parents went every year to Jerusalem at the feast of the Passover.
verses.ct: Every year, Jesus' parents traveled to Jerusalem for the feast of the Passover.

verses.kjv: And when he was twelve years old, they went up to Jerusalem after the custom of the feast.
verses.web: When he was twelve years old, they went up to Jerusalem according to the custom of the feast,
verses.ct: When Jesus was 12 years old, they went up to Jerusalem as usual for the festival.

verses.kjv: And when they had fulfilled the days, as they returned, the child Jesus tarried behind in Jerusalem; and Joseph and his mother knew not of it.
verses.web: and when they had fulfilled the days, as they were returning, the boy Jesus stayed behind in Jerusalem. Joseph and his mother didn’t know it,
verses.ct: After the celebration ended, they started the journey home, but the boy Jesus stayed behind in Jerusalem. His parents didn't realize it.

verses.kjv: But they, supposing him to have been in the company, went a day’s journey; and they sought him among their kinsfolk and acquaintance.
verses.web: but supposing him to be in the company, they went a day’s journey, and they looked for him among their relatives and acquaintances.
verses.ct: Assuming he was somewhere in the traveling group, they went a full day's journey before they started looking for him among their relatives and friends.

verses.kjv: And when they found him not, they turned back again to Jerusalem, seeking him.
verses.web: When they didn’t find him, they returned to Jerusalem, looking for him.
verses.ct: When they couldn't find him, they turned around and went back to Jerusalem to search for him.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass, that after three days they found him in the temple, sitting in the midst of the doctors, both hearing them, and asking them questions.
verses.web: After three days they found him in the temple, sitting in the middle of the teachers, both listening to them, and asking them questions.
verses.ct: After 3 days, they finally found him in the temple, sitting among the religious teachers, listening to them and asking questions.

verses.kjv: And all that heard him were astonished at his understanding and answers.
verses.web: All who heard him were amazed at his understanding and his answers.
verses.ct: Everyone who heard him was stunned by his understanding and his answers.

verses.kjv: And when they saw him, they were amazed: and his mother said unto him, Son, why hast thou thus dealt with us? behold, thy father and I have sought thee sorrowing.
verses.web: When they saw him, they were astonished, and his mother said to him, “Son, why have you treated us this way? Behold, your father and I were anxiously looking for you.”
verses.ct: When his parents saw him, they were shocked. His mother said to him, "Son, why have you done this to us? Your father and I have been searching for you everywhere, worried sick!"

verses.kjv: And he said unto them, How is it that ye sought me? wist ye not that I must be about my Father’s business?
verses.web: He said to them, “Why were you looking for me? Didn’t you know that I must be in my Father’s house?”
verses.ct: He replied, "Why were you searching for me? Didn't you know that I had to be in my Father's house?"

verses.kjv: And they understood not the saying which he spake unto them.
verses.web: They didn’t understand the saying which he spoke to them.
verses.ct: But they didn't understand what he meant.

verses.kjv: And he went down with them, and came to Nazareth, and was subject unto them: but his mother kept all these sayings in her heart.
verses.web: And he went down with them, and came to Nazareth. He was subject to them, and his mother kept all these sayings in her heart.
verses.ct: Then he went back to Nazareth with them and was obedient to them. His mother held all these things close in her heart.

verses.kjv: And Jesus increased in wisdom and stature, and in favour with God and man.
verses.web: And Jesus increased in wisdom and stature, and in favor with God and men.
verses.ct: Jesus grew in wisdom and stature, and in favor with both God and people.
